translated: Birth Stories🔽The Collection of Birth Stories
The Chapter on the Unprotected
The Birth Story of Dhammadhaja
“Practice the Dhamma, relatives,
practice the good for your sake;
One who practices the Dhamma sleeps well,
in this world and the next.”
“This bird is truly excellent,
the supreme practitioner of Dhamma;
Standing on one foot,
he teaches the Dhamma alone.”
“You don’t know his virtue,
praising him without knowing;
Having eaten his eggs and young,
he speaks of Dhamma as Dhamma.
He speaks one thing with his speech,

original: aññaṁ kāyena kubbati;🔽Vācāya no ca kāyena,
analyzed: aññam kāyena kubbati  vācāya na u ca kāyena
translated: but does another with his body;🔽Not established in that Dhamma
with his speech but not his body.
With a friendly face and a deceitful mind,

analyzed: channaḥ kūpa sayaḥ uva kaṇha sappaḥ
translated: like a black snake in a pit,
Dhammadhaja is good in the villages and towns,
but hard to know by a person who is foolish.
With your beaks and wings,
harm him on the top of his feet;
Destroy this corpse,

analyzed: na ayam sa vāsanā rahāḥ iti 🔽dhamma dhaja jātakam navama
translated: he is not fit to live with.”🔽The Ninth Birth Story, that of Dhammadhaja.
